author: wlievens
title: One of the best medieval entries of the whole theme
review:
Those of us who enjoy fantasy or historical themed minifigs have been treated well already by the past fourteen series of collectable minifigures, but even so this is in my view one of the best such figures ever.

The costom body, all the way up to the legs, is the highlight of the model, because it's very detailed and quite unlike other medieval torso's. The shield complements this well, and since I'm a bit of a heraldy nut I'm happy every time I spot a new shield design.

The color patterns of the shield don't really match that of the body, and it's a pity the mace is not one component like most other weapons, but I won't detract any points for that.

author: Ernst
title: Vladek's ugly brother with Sir Santis' shield.
review:
Overall 5 bricks : Every now and then there passes a, most of the times historical, CMF that I like so much a review is in place. This Frightening Knight is one again. Most of all I hope this will be a messenger of a new Castle bad guys faction !! And yes : with his looks he and Vladek could be related.

Building 1 brick : assembling a mini figure can not be called building

Parts 5 bricks : A familiar helmet but for a Knight new shoulder armour. Legs and torso with a great print of course exclusively for this minifigure. The weapon is a new 2 part mace and what I like most is the new shield which reminds me of the shield of Sir Santis in Knights Kingdom II that showed also a bear as blazonry. The face of this new bad guy reminded me of the grumpy grin of Lord Vladek although this face is better and more detailed of course.

Playability 5 bricks : Can be used in all your Castle sets and adventures, for a good bad guy bunch get several of them and reward the leader with a green or black cape.

Value 5 bricks : like all CMF's € 3,00 is a reasonable price especially if it is a good one like this.

author: Odeinoichus
title: A Bear of a Time.
review:
Set #71011 Frightening Knight: Castle's first representative in CMF Series 15 is an evil knight character in dark green with medium stone grey accents. He's fairly impressive and fits in quite nicely with the LEGO Kingdoms Dragon Knights from our last Castle inspired theme. The colours match fairly well.

This terrifying knight is dressed in a long dark green robe over his chain mail suit. He has dual-molded legs to represent his boots and his arm guards are printed on the sides of the arms. He's also sporting a single tooth sticking out of his dull unimpressed facial expression, and a scruffy looking beard. His shield is printed with a snarling bear, yes I do believe that is meant to be a bear and not a wolf. And he's got a buildable mace weapon to attack his foes with.

Overall the Frightening Knight looks extremely impressive. I'd recommend getting a few of them, and owning at least one from this Series is a must because of the impressive level of detail. Strongly recommended.

author: lkb57
title: A Perfect Addition to Any Castle Collection
review:
I have wanted this minifig from the moment from the moment Series 15 was announced. I'm slowly building up a Castle/LOTR collection, and I was super excited to finally pick it up.

The design of the minifig's outfit is fantastic, with a green robe trimmed with dark green fur that is open on the front to reveal a chain mail coat. I think TLG did an excellent job illustrating the chain mail at this scale . . . too small and it wouldn't have shown up well, and any larger and it would have looked strange. The printing of the robe and armor is continued on the arms and legs.

The shield design is excellent as well, and will make a very versatile part of Castle MOCs. I was also excited about the mace, which is a fairly rare part, as far as I can tell.

In short, I'm very pleased with this guy. I'm planning on using the torso and legs to create another Rohan soldier for an upcoming MOC.
